other_tests.findings: Characteristic histologic appearance of a giant congenital melanocytic nevus (GCMN); epidermis showed mild hyperkeratosis and moderate hyperpigmentation of the basal layer.
other_tests.changes_over_time: After multiple surgical reductions, there were improved symptoms, but pruritus remained localized to the perineal region.

other_tests.findings: Normal mucosa without evidence of bleeding.
Increased number of CD117-positive mast cells uniformly distributed in the nevus.
Significantly improved pruritus; wounds were healing.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Indicated improvement after treatment with ondansetron.
